page.title: 19POLITICS
page.content: {POLITICS}The Parish Council is elected by the people of Coggeshall to represent them.Every four years the Parish Council elects a Chairman Brian Haynes is the present Chairman.At the moment the Parish Council owns 25 acres of land,about 10 acres being recreation ground.They collect money from house owners in the district "rates" and use it in maintaning footpaths,street lights,grass cutting and churchyards.They also voluntarly keep the streets tidy because they feel it should be done properly.They have rather limited powers and can only comment on planning applications for new houses etc.The District Council (based at Braintree)makes the final decision.Two of the governors of the schools have to be Parish Councillors.The Council employs three people to work in Coggeshall.
